text:
Mass shootings are often motivated by some combination of: radical ideology; personal animus; psychological derangement. Access to weapons makes them possible.

In any given case one of these factors can seem most important, but they are not mutually exclusive.

author: joshgreenman

text: And you’ll apply that regardless of background? Seems to me that some people still love the power of being able to throw around Muslim-sounding terrorists’ names. And I personally am a bit conflicted on the name thing. We need to know who murderers are and why they act.

text:
Yes, starve mass killers of attention. Yes, bury their names.

No, don’t ignore this man’s manifesto. His manifesto explains his motivations. We need to understand terrorists’ motivations, Islamist or white nationalist or otherwise, to have hope of stopping them.
